body:
_Originally posted by @easlice in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/discussions/32996_

It's been a couple of months and I'm still experiencing this, so making this an issue instead of a discussion.

-----

I know this has been asked a lot and, usually, is environmental, so I thought I'd ask here instead of starting with an issue report.

I'm running gentoo and installed neovim through portage. I use alacritty as my terminal.

When I am outside of tmux HOME and END keys work as expected in both vim and nvim whether my TERM is set to alacritty, xterm-256color, or tmux-256color.

Inside of tmux, HOME and END do not work in nvim (whether the TERM is set to tmux-256color or screen-256color) but they do work in vim.

Under tmux, when I hit Ctrl+V `<End>` or Ctrl+V `<Home>` in vim I get `^[[4~` and `^[[1~`, respectively. In nvim the `<End>` and `<Home>` are completely ignored, as if I didn't press a key.

What might I be doing wrong here?

Below is the nvim version info:
```
NVIM v0.10.3
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1716656478
Compilation: /usr/bin/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-gcc -march=native -O2 -pipe   -Wall -Wextra -pedantic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wstrict-prototypes -std=gnu99 -Wshadow -Wconversion -Wvla -Wdouble-promotion -Wmissing-noreturn -Wmissing-format-attribute -Wmissing-prototypes -fsigned-char -fstack-protector-strong -Wno-conversion -fno-common -Wno-unused-result -Wimplicit-fallthrough -fdiagnostics-color=always  -DUNIT_TESTING -DHAVE_UNIBILIUM -D_GNU_SOURCE -DINCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS -I/usr/include/luajit-2.1 -I/usr/include -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.10.3/work/neovim-0.10.3_build/src/nvim/auto -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.10.3/work/neovim-0.10.3_build/include -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.10.3/work/neovim-0.10.3_build/cmake.config -I/var/tmp/portage/app-editors/neovim-0.10.3/work/neovim-0.10.3/src
```

-----
EDIT (2025-Mar-27): Using st as my term also shows the same behavior, but it made me notice something. When I am in a tmux session, setting the TERM to tmux-256color or screen-256color does not let the HOME or END keys work in nvim. If I change it to xterm-256color or alacritty (I know this is not correct, I was just wondering what happens), it also does not let the HOME or END keys work. But if I change it to st-256color, it _does_ allow HOME and END keys to work.

comment_data.body:
> NVIM v0.10.3

That is not even the latest 0.10.x release

auto-closing since the latest release, not to mention nightly, was not tested

Sorry if what was before wasn't good enough, that was the latest in portage.
Can we reopen this?

I just tested it with version 0.11.1 and 0.12.0-dev-330+g1b8ae4336d (the latest  release and nightly) from the binary releases here, and now in tmux hitting `<HOME>` and `<END>` output `<Find>` and `<Select>` (in both releases).
Hmm, that's strange. Is the output of `infocmp -Lx` in tmux still the same as <https://github.com/neovim/neovim/discussions/32996#discussioncomment-12562287>?

> Hmm, that's strange. Is the output of `infocmp -Lx` in tmux still the same as [#32996 (reply in thread)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/discussions/32996#discussioncomment-12562287)?

This is quite strange, as it appears that Nvim is falling back to the builtin terminfo even if the terminfo for tmux isn't available, but even the builtin terminfo isn't working when it should. Can you try installing Nvim in a different way (e.g. downloading the appimage from the Release page)?

> This is quite strange, as it appears that Nvim is falling back to the builtin terminfo even if the terminfo for tmux isn't available, but even the builtin terminfo isn't working when it should. Can you try installing Nvim in a different way (e.g. downloading the appimage from the Release page)?

@zeertzjq I grabbed the nightly appimage from today and was playing around with it. I was seeing the same behavior and was thinking about what you said, about it falling back to builtin definitions even with the terminfo available. I thought it might be that nvim couldn't find the terminfo, for some reason, so I tried running it as root (in case it was a permission problem). Surprisingly, things worked and when I checked the `-V3` log, it found the system terminfo.

I `straced` it both as my user and as root and found that, as my user, nvim was looking for terminfo definitions under the following places:
`$HOME/.terminfo/...`
`/usr/share/st/terminfo/...`
But MY terminfo files are under `/usr/share/terminfo/...`, the only ones under `/usr/share/st/terminfo/...` are the definitions for the term st. (Which is why setting my `TERM` to `st` worked before in my testing.)

When I did the same for root, nvim looked in the following places:
`/root/.terminfo/...` (So, `$HOME` again)
`/etc/terminfo/...`
And so it was able to find the terminal definitions under `/etc`

So it looks like the issue is because it isn't looking under `/usr/share/terminfo/...`
Hmm, is the `TERMINFO_DIRS` environment variable set? A similar thing may have happened before in <https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24368#issuecomment-1664035896>.

> Hmm, is the `TERMINFO_DIRS` environment variable set? A similar thing may have happened before in [#24368 (comment)](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24368#issuecomment-1664035896).

Yes, yes it is, to `/usr/share/st/terminfo`. If I unset it, then it finds my term definition and works fine. I am also running gentoo (like in the quoted issue) and have st installed.

Thanks for that, this has been driving me crazy!

title: Yet Another HOME and END keys issue with tmux
